intro: Oldenlandia verticillata var. trichocarpa, commonly known as the threadleaf spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its slender, thread-like leaves and clusters of small, white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and streambanks. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with showy flowers. The variety trichocarpa is distinguished by its finely textured, hairy leaves that give it a unique appearance.
